embeds.description:
# Choose a Race
### High Elf
As a high elf, you have a keen mind and a mastery of
at least the basics of magic. In many of the worlds of
D&D, there are two kinds of high elves. One type (which
includes the gray elves and valley elves of Greyhawk,
the Silvanesti of Dragonlance, and the sun elves of the
Forgotten Realms) is haughty and reclusive, believing
themselves to be superior to non-elves and even other
elves. The other type (including the high elves of Greyhawk, the Qualinesti of Dragonlance, and the moon elves
of the Forgotten Realms) are more common and more
friendly, and often encountered among humans and
other races.

fields.name: • Darkvision
fields.value: *Elves can see in dim light within 60 feet as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. They can't discern colors in darkness, only shades of gray.*

fields.name: • Cantrip
fields.value: *Cantrip Learn one cantrip from the wizard spell list. Intelligence is the spellcasting ability for this cantrip.*

fields.name: • Keen Senses
fields.value: *Proficiency in the Perception skill, representing their heightened awareness.*

fields.name: • Fey Ancestry
fields.value: *Advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic cannot put them to sleep. This stems from their fey heritage.*

fields.name: • Trance
fields.value: *Instead of sleeping for 8 hours, elves meditate deeply for 4 hours to gain the same benefits as a long rest. They remain semi-conscious during this time, so they are harder to surprise.*

fields.name: • Languages
fields.value:
*Common.
Elvish.
+1 language of your choice choice.*

fields.name: • Size
fields.value: *Elves range from under 5 to over 6 feet tall and have slender builds. Your size is Medium.*
